noun.description: The power or right to give orders, make decisions, and enforce obedience.
examples: he had absolute authority over his subordinates
a rebellion against those in authority
they acted under the authority of the UN Security Council

noun.description: A person or organization having power or control in a particular, typically political or administrative, sphere.
examples: the authorities ordered all foreign embassies to close
she wasn't used to dealing with authority

noun.description: The power to influence others, especially because of one's commanding manner or one's recognized knowledge about something.
examples: he has the natural authority of one who is used to being obeyed
he spoke with authority on the subject

phrases: I have it on good authority that there is a waiting list of up to five weeks
And no, I haven't read the book but I have it on good authority (my mum and dad) that it's a great read.
For this column has it on good authority that the island is about to be bought by a Japanese / British consortium and transformed into a racetrack for one of the quickest growing sports in Europe.
I have it on good authority that he has left the company.
I have it on good authority that he is a personal friend of hers.
origin: Middle English: from Old French autorite, from Latin auctoritas, from auctor originator, promoter (see author).
